title: Introducing a New Skin Theme: Noble/Noblesse.
body:
Let's bring some **elegance** and **style** to LoL. Was browsing the net and found some cool "skins" that would fit certain champions GREATLY! 

**Check this out:**

replies.body:
So the female versions of debonair skins. 
I say this because debonair(stylish, charming) is pretty much masculine elegance
I prefer to think Debonair is the name of a club in Piltover.

deb·o·nair
ˌdebəˈner/
adjective
adjective: debonair

    (of a man) confident, stylish, and charming.
    synonyms:	suave, urbane, sophisticated, cultured, self-possessed, self-assured, confident, charming, gracious, courteous, gallant, chivalrous, gentlemanly, refined, polished, well bred, genteel, dignified, courtly; More
    well groomed, elegant, stylish, smart, dashing;
    informalsmooth, sharp, cool, slick, fly
    "as debonair as Cary Grant"
    antonyms:	unsophisticated
*LOL
Although 'Debonair' never inspired me, I guess you can put it that way.
You have to realize though that before it was made a piltover only skin line, most people believed it was going to be the "Suits and stylish clothes" skin line

This is a really cool idea. How would you handle stuff like particles? (the Debonair line not having any particle changes) 

What would be the main hook on a 'Noble' skin? Just lady champs in fancy clothes or something else in particular?

(Also Eden of the East? Noblesse Oblige :p )

Thanks Veivet. I prefer skins to have customized particles, to give them an extra personalized touch. But I didn't do my homework and thought of them T_T. Something with hearts perhaps, im up for suggestions ;).

How do people not get that Riot has different teams for different aspects of the game...

I actually have some ideas:

For Riven{{champion:92}}  it could be like ribbons whipping about. To explain more clearly, think of her Wind Slash like instead of this green runic energy cutting you, it's a blast of a ribbon tearing through you. I don't know if I explained that well, but I hope someone understands what I'm trying to say.

Leona{{champion:89}}  was trickier to think of, but I managed to think that instead of sunlight for her particles it could be more "fancy". Like a ballroom spotlight for her ult (a nice tune of music would be cool instead of sunbeam sounds). Just something not sunlight

Kayle, hmm.. Any ideas?

But ya although the two ideas match up for particles, it seems more "noble" than nothing at all

Here's my opinion on this, and remember, it's an opinion. This skin line idea just seems terribly boring. The concept? Elegant looking female champs? That's a tad lame. And the example you have proposed, especially the Leona one, appear to be a tad...fetish fuel. And the female champions are already a tad bit boring visually, since most of them all use the same body type and even extremely similar facial features. Female champs need more interesting and cool skins that aren't just them playing dress up. 

I suppose my logic is flawed though. I suppose our beloved Rito overlords have trouble coming up with an interesting skin theme, because most female champs do stick to that same aforementioned stale body and facial type. We have no female monster champions, and for some reason the Shadow isles has no female specters, only scantly clad women. So excuse me if I came of as rude.

-just my 200 cents, and a nickel.
Well i agreed if diana got one too :D poor her {{champion:131}}  she got so much no low (i dont like to play her but i like the concept)

I'd really like to see some sort of feminine equivalent to the debonair skin line. Not sure which champions would be most fitting for the concept though. I feel like thematically, Fiora would be a great choice. :)

They look like level 0 female characters from generic RPGS.
want o.o

Try Vindictus, you might find something for Varus and a sword-wielding Leona outfit.

Just putting this out there, but "noblesse" isn't the feminine form of "noble".  It's just the noble class, or being born to nobility.  It's French-- "Noblesse oblige" it the idea of the obligations of nobility.
I know, I looked it up before I placed it here lol. It just gives it more elegance!
